p: Annual incidence rates averaged over epidemic years of the study period were artificially low in 4 of the islands surrounding New Caledonia (Mare, Lifou, Ouvéa, Isle of Pines) as the only vector of dengue in New Caledonia, Aedes aegypti, was not present over the entire study period [ 54– 56]. We thus decided to limit the analysis to New Caledonia's mainland, comprising 28 communes.
